questions.prompt: In BG 15.1, what does Krishna compare to a tree?
choices: The material world; with roots above and branches below
questions.feedback: The cosmos is structured like an inverted tree rooted in Krishna.

questions.prompt: According to BG 15.2, what are the characteristics of this cosmic tree?
choices: Its roots are above; branches extend in all directions; Vedas speak of it
questions.feedback: The Vedas describe the cosmic tree's structure and significance.

questions.prompt: In BG 15.3, what prevents one from seeing the cosmic tree truly?
choices: Neither its beginning, middle, nor end is perceived; attachment binds one
questions.feedback: Material conditioning obscures the true nature of cosmic reality.

questions.prompt: What does BG 15.4 teach about the path to the cosmic tree?
choices: One must seek the source with strong conviction; cut the roots with detachment
questions.feedback: Detachment and knowledge are the axe to sever material attachment.

questions.prompt: According to BG 15.5, what characterizes those free from delusion?
choices: Freed from pride, delusion, attachment, and desire; they achieve the eternal abode
questions.feedback: Freedom from illusion leads to the ultimate destination.

questions.prompt: In BG 15.6, what is the nature of the eternal abode?
choices: The place where I dwell; none from there return to material world
questions.feedback: Krishna's realm is eternal and permanent, beyond material change.

questions.prompt: What does BG 15.7 teach about the living beings in the material world?
choices: They are fragments of me; an eternal part of my being
questions.feedback: All jivas (souls) are integral parts of Krishna's supreme existence.

questions.prompt: According to BG 15.8, what are the senses controlled by?
choices: The living being is controlled by mind; the mind by senses
questions.feedback: The hierarchy of control flows from consciousness to mind to senses.

questions.prompt: In BG 15.9, what happens to the living being at death?
choices: The living being departs with mind and senses; carries impressions to new body
questions.feedback: The soul carries impressions and consciousness to its next birth.

questions.prompt: What does BG 15.10 teach about what the embodied soul obtains?
choices: Obtains a body suitable to his consciousness; obtains the results of his actions
questions.feedback: The quality of one's consciousness determines one's next birth.

questions.prompt: According to BG 15.11-12, how can one perceive the Almighty?
choices: Yogis who discipline mind and senses can perceive the Lord within
questions.feedback: Disciplined practice enables direct perception of the Divine.

questions.prompt: In BG 15.13, what does Krishna declare about His nature?
choices: I support all with one portion of myself; I pervade the entire creation
questions.feedback: Krishna sustains the entire cosmos with a minute fraction of His potency.

questions.prompt: What does BG 15.14 teach about the source of energy and light?
choices: I am the source of all light; both sun and moon shine by my energy
questions.feedback: All energy in the universe flows from Krishna's supreme potency.

questions.prompt: According to BG 15.15, what is Krishna's role in the body and soul?
choices: I am seated in everyone's heart; from me come memory, knowledge, and forgetfulness
questions.feedback: Krishna directs consciousness and controls memory in all beings.

questions.prompt: In BG 15.16, what are the two aspects of existence Krishna describes?
choices: The perishable (matter) and the imperishable (soul); both exist
questions.feedback: Existence comprises both temporary material and eternal spiritual aspects.

questions.prompt: What does BG 15.17 teach about the Supreme Person?
choices: Beyond the perishable and imperishable; I am supreme; known as Paramatma
questions.feedback: Krishna is the ultimate source beyond all dualities and conditions.

questions.prompt: According to BG 15.18, who is the greatest and most worshipable?
choices: One who knows me as the Supreme Self is my devotee and worships rightly
questions.feedback: Perfect knowledge of Krishna leads to the highest form of worship.

questions.prompt: In BG 15.19, what is the conclusion about understanding Krishna fully?
choices: One who knows me in truth; enters my nature and loves me eternally
questions.feedback: Complete knowledge of Krishna grants eternal entrance to His divine realm.

questions.prompt: What is the main teaching of Chapter 15?
choices: Krishna is the source of all; understanding this liberates one
questions.feedback: Chapter 15 reveals Krishna as the supreme source and sustainer.

questions.prompt: In BG 15, what is the significance of the cosmic tree?
choices: It represents the material universe and the path to transcend it
questions.feedback: The tree symbolizes the structure of material creation.

questions.prompt: According to Chapter 15, how does one escape the material world?
choices: By understanding Krishna's supremacy and surrendering to Him
questions.feedback: True knowledge of Krishna enables escape from material bondage.

questions.prompt: What does the cosmic tree represent in practical terms?
choices: The cycle of birth, death, and rebirth driven by karma
questions.feedback: The tree symbolizes the material condition and cycle of reincarnation.

questions.prompt: In BG 15, what is promised to those who understand these truths?
choices: They achieve eternal peace and return to Krishna's abode
questions.feedback: Understanding leads to permanent liberation and divine association.

questions.prompt: What is the ultimate conclusion of Chapter 15?
choices: Krishna is eternal; He alone is the Supreme Truth to worship
questions.feedback: The final teaching points to exclusive devotion to the Supreme.

questions.feedback: The final teaching points to exclusive devotion to the Supreme.
